chat.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è GitHub - umputun/simplotask: A user-friendly and efficient tool for the effortless deployment and configuration of resources on remote machines. - https://github.com/umputun/simplotask

GitHub - umputun/simplotask: A user-friendly and efficient tool for the effortless deployment and configuration of resources on remote machines.

SimploTask is a tool for deploying and managing resources on remote machines, with support for task-based command execution and custom inventory files/URLs. Features include concurrent task execution, script execution, command types like copy/sync/delete/wait, custom environment variables, and more.

- Define tasks with lists of commands and support for remote hosts through inventory files/URLs
- Built-in command types include script, copy, sync, delete, and wait
- Concurrent execution of tasks on multiple hosts with option to wait for specific conditions
- Customizable environment variables and ability to override destinations, SSH username/key, and execute only specific commands
- Optional hook for executing commands on local host when there is an error
- Debug mode for detailed command output and error messages
- Uses only a single binary with no external dependencies
- Supports runtime variables for use in scripts and commands
‚ö†Ô∏è Personalized Generative AI with GrammarlyGO | Grammarly - https://www.grammarly.com/blog/grammarlygo-personalized-ai-writing/

Personalized Generative AI with GrammarlyGO | Grammarly

Grammarly has launched a personalized generative AI feature, called GrammarlyGO, which will assist writers with text generation and assist in revisions until the work reaches its best form. The new feature is available to Grammarly Premium, Grammarly Business, Grammarly for Education, and free plan users in the US, UK, Canada, Poland, Japan, Germany, Ukraine, New Zealand, and Australia. GrammarlyGO is integrated within Grammarly's existing products, which will eventually become available in all the apps the company is compatible with. The tool aims to assist all stages of communication: ideation, composition, revision, and comprehension.

- Grammarly has introduced a personalized generative AI feature called GrammarlyGO to help writers with text generation.
- The tool is available to all Grammarly Premium, Grammarly Business, and Grammarly for Education users, as well as users of Grammarly‚Äôs free plan in a few countries.
- GrammarlyGO will be available everywhere Grammarly is usable in the future.
- The tool is integrated with apps like Gmail and Microsoft Word and does not require switching back and forth between applications.
- Users can set their voice in the tool, including their preferred tones and professional roles.
- GrammarlyGO upholds Grammarly‚Äôs long-standing commitment to developing AI responsibly, with privacy and security top of mind.
- The AI feature assists in all stages of communication, from ideation to composition to revision to comprehension.

‚ö†Ô∏è Mark Zuckerberg says Meta wants to ‚Äúintroduce AI agents to billions of people‚Äù - https://www.theverge.com/2023/4/26/23699633/mark-zuckerberg-meta-generative-ai-chatbots-instagram-facebook-whatsapp

Meta wants to ‚Äòintroduce AI agents to billions of people‚Äô - The Verge

Meta is planning to incorporate AI agents into its platforms in a meaningful and helpful way.

- CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the company's intention to introduce generative AI products to billions of people.
- Meta has spent billions to overhaul its data centres to build the infrastructure needed to support AI features.
- Meta released an AI language model called LLaMA to researchers earlier this year and has been racing to build ChatGPT-like applications.
- Generative AI is set to "literally touch every single one of [Meta's] products" and speed up WhatsApp's customer support business.
- Meta is not abandoning its metaverse plans and will debut the next Quest VR headset later this year.
- Meta has said its products will be valuable for everyone from regular people to creators to businesses.

‚ö†Ô∏è Brave Search removes last remnant of Bing from search results page, achieving 100% independence and providing real alternative to Big Tech search | Brave Browser - https://brave.com/search-independence/

Brave Search removes last remnant of Bing from search results page, achieving 100% independence and providing real alternative to Big Tech search | Brave Browser

Brave Search, an independent search engine, has achieved complete independence from Bing, providing a real alternative to Big Tech search. Brave Search is also launching its own search API to power other search applications in the near future.

- Brave Search has removed all search API calls to Bing, achieving 100% independence.
- The independence does not compromise the quality of search results.
- Users can still use Google Fallback mixing if they want to.
- The removal of all Bing API calls may affect certain regional or language-specific results.
- Brave is planning to release the Brave Search API for developers and companies.
- Users can support Brave Search by telling others about Brave and opting into the Web Discovery Project to help grow the index.
- Users can provide feedback to help improve search results and use Goggles to customize ranking.
